types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

types.name: Int64
types.description: A 64 bit integer

types.name: HexString
types.description: A hex-encoded string

types.name: Amount
types.description: Amount in a specific currency.

fields.name: amount
fields.description: amount in currency microunits

fields.name: currency
fields.description: currency string identifier

types.name: Account
types.description: A Libra account.

fields.name: sequenceNumber
fields.description: The next sequence number for the current account

fields.name: authenticationKey
fields.description: Hex-encoded authentication key for the account

fields.name: delegatedKeyRotationCapability
fields.description: If true, another account has the ability to rotate the authentication key for this account.

fields.name: delegatedWithdrawalCapacity
fields.description: If true, another account has the ability to withdraw funds from this account.

fields.name: balance
fields.description: Balance of given account

fields.name: sentEventsKey
fields.description: Unique key for the sent events stream of this account

fields.name: receivedEventsKey
fields.description: Unique key for the received events stream of this account

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: EventData
types.description: An event emitted during a transaction

fields.name: type
fields.description: Const string for the event type

types.name: ReceivedPaymentEvent
types.description: Event emitted when an account received a payment.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Const string “receivedpayment”

fields.name: amount
fields.description: Amount received from the sender of the transaction

fields.name: sender
fields.description: Hex-encoded address of the sender of the transaction that emitted the given event

fields.name: metadata
fields.description:
An optional field that can contain extra metadata for the event.
Note: This information can be used by an off-chain API to implement a sub-addressing scheme for a wallet.

types.name: SentPaymentEvent
types.description: Event emitted when an account sends a payment.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Const string “sentpayment”

fields.name: amount
fields.description: Amount transferred in a transaction

fields.name: receiver
fields.description: Hex-encoded address of the receiver of an associated transaction

fields.name: metadata
fields.description:
An optional field that can contain extra metadata for the event.
Note: This information can be used by another API to implement a subaddressing scheme for a wallet

types.name: UnknownEvent
types.description: Represents events currently unsupported by JSON-RPC API.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Const string “unknown”

types.name: Event
types.description: An event emitted during a transaction

fields.name: key
fields.description: Gobally unique identifier of event stream

fields.name: sequenceNumber
fields.description: Sequence number of the current event in the given even stream

fields.name: transactionVersion
fields.description: Version of the transaction that emitted this event

fields.name: data
fields.description: ReceivedPayment or SentPayment or UnknownEvent object

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: Metadata
types.description: Current state of a Libra full node

fields.name: version
fields.description: The latest transaction version

fields.name: timestamp
fields.description: the block timestamp

types.name: TransactionData
types.description: Metadata for this transaction. Possible types are BlockMetadataTransaction, WriteSetTransaction, UserTransaction, UnknownTransaction.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Const string for the transaction type

types.name: BlockMetadataTransaction
types.description: A Libra network transaction that contains the metadata for the block. This transaction is always at the beginning of a block.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Const string “blockmetadata”

fields.name: timestampUsecs
fields.description: Timestamp for the current block, in microseconds

types.name: WriteSetTransaction
types.description: A Libra network transaction that modifies storage data directly. Currently, no details are exposed in the API.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Const string “writeset”

types.name: UserTransactionScript
types.description: Metadata for unsupported transaction types

fields.name: type
fields.description: Const string “unknown”

types.name: PeerToPeerTransferScript
types.description: Transaction script for peer-to-peer transfer of resource

fields.name: type
fields.description: Const string “peer_to_peer_transaction”

fields.name: receiver
fields.description: The receiver libra address

fields.name: authKeyPrefix
fields.description: The auth_key_prefix

fields.name: amount
fields.description: The amount of microlibras being sent

fields.name: metadata
fields.description: The metadata supplied

types.name: MintScript
types.description: Transaction script for a special transaction used by the faucet to mint Libra and send to a user.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Const string “mint_transaction”

fields.name: receiver
fields.description: The receiver libra address

fields.name: authKeyPrefix
fields.description: The auth_key_prefix

fields.name: amount
fields.description: The amount of microlibras being sent

types.name: UnknownScript
types.description: Currently unsupported transaction script

fields.name: type
fields.description: Const string “unknown_transaction”

types.name: UserTransaction
types.description: User submitted transaction.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Const string “user”

fields.name: sender
fields.description: Hex-encoded account address of the sender

fields.name: signatureScheme
fields.description: Signature scheme used to sign this transaction

fields.name: signature
fields.description: Hex-encoded signature of this transaction

fields.name: publicKey
fields.description: Hex-encoded public key of the transaction sender

fields.name: sequenceNumber
fields.description: Sequence number of this transaction corresponding to sender's account

fields.name: maxGasAmount
fields.description: Maximum amount of gas that can be spent for this transaction

fields.name: gasUnitPrice
fields.description: Maximum gas price to be paid per unit of gas

fields.name: expirationTime
fields.description: The expiration time (Unix Epoch in seconds) for this transaction

fields.name: scriptHash
fields.description: Hex-encoded hash of the script used in this transaction

fields.name: script
fields.description: The transaction script and arguments of this transaction, represented as one of PeerToPeerTransferScript, MintScript or UnknownScript.

types.name: UnknownTransaction
types.description: Metadata for unsupported transaction types

fields.name: type
fields.description: Const string “unknown”

types.name: Transaction
types.description: A transaction on the blockchain.

fields.name: version
fields.description: The on-chain version or unique identifier of this transaction

fields.name: events
fields.description: List of associated events. Empty for no events

fields.name: transactionData
fields.description: Metadata for this transaction. Possible types are BlockMetadataTransaction, WriteSetTransaction, UserTransaction, UnknownTransaction.

fields.name: vmStatus
fields.description: Status code representing the result of the VM processing this transaction.

fields.name: gasUsed
fields.description: Amount of gas used by this transaction

fields.name: accountState
fields.description: Get the latest account state for a given account.

fields.name: accountTransaction
fields.description: Get the transaction sent by the account with the given sequence number

args.name: account
args.description: The account address, a hex-encoded string

args.name: includeEvents
args.description: Set to true to also fetch events generated by the transaction

fields.name: events
fields.description: Fetch the events for a given event stream.

args.name: key
args.description:
Globally unique identifier of an event stream.
Note: For sent and received events, a client can use accountState to get the event key of the event streams for a given user.

args.name: start
args.description: Start at the event with this sequence number

fields.name: metadata
fields.description:
Get the current blockchain metadata (e.g., current state of a Libra full node).
You can use this endpoint to verify liveness / status of nodes in the network:
metadata returns the latest transaction version and the block timestamp. If the timestamp or version is old (from the past), it means that the full node is not not up-to-date.

fields.name: transactions
fields.description: Get the transactions on the blockchain

args.name: startVersion
args.description: Start on this transaction version for this query

args.name: limit
args.description: Limit the number of transactions returned

args.name: includeEvents
args.description: Set to true, to also fetch events for each transaction

types.name: ErrorData
types.description:
A Primitive or Structured value that contains additional information about the error.
The value of this member is defined by the Server (e.g. detailed error information, nested errors etc.).

types.name: ErrorPayload
types.description:
A generic JSON-RPC error payload
see: https://www.jsonrpc.org/specification#error_object

fields.name: code
fields.description: A Number that indicates the error type that occurred.

fields.name: message
fields.description: A String providing a short description of the error.

fields.name: data
fields.description:
A Primitive or Structured value that contains additional information about the error.
The value of this member is defined by the Server (e.g. detailed error information, nested errors etc.).

types.name: SubmitInput
types.description: Input args for submit.

inputFields.name: data
inputFields.description: Signed transaction data - hex-encoded bytes of serialized Libra SignedTransaction type.

fields.name: submit
fields.description: Submit a signed transaction to a full node.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax, as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).
